column4: Is there a linux permission for read + write but prevents users from deleting?
that kind of perm makes no sense

- its all good. I just realized the answer to my question above. If I own /media/storage and give the users group access, even RWX access, they can read/write but they cant delete /media/storage itself. They can delete stuff inside, but not /media/storage (the root folder, more or less)
